results.title: A Streetcar named Desire
results.creator_credit: Charles K. Feldman and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Stars Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando. Based on the play by Tennessee Williams. Also stars Karl Malden.

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Hugh Stewart and Robert Asher
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.

results.title: A Star is born [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David O. Selznick and William Wellman
results.brief_description: The rise of a small-time singer to Hollywood stardom is matched by the decline of her actor-mentor, then husband. A melodrama, a musical comedy and a musical-within-a-musical which, beneath its mythmaking about Hollywood, achieves a rare depth of emotion and sense of truthfulness. Cast includes Janet Gaynor, Frederic March, Adolphe Menjou and May Robson.

results.title: A Song to remember
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Louis F. Edelman and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: Cornel Wilde is the tragic composer Chopin and Merle Oberon plays the radical feminist writer George Sands. ‘A Song to remember’ tells the story of this great pianist, fighting for the freedom of his beloved Poland and inspired by two beautiful women - one who loved him selflessly; the other who was cruel and aloof. Chopin’s life and genius was cut short in the full flower of his musical greatness. ‘A Song to remember’ is a sentimental costume drama and features the skilled playing of Jose Iturbi. This film was nominated for seven Academy Awards and also stars Paul Muni as Chopin’s mentor and nina Foch.

results.title: A Soldier's story [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Caldix Films, Columbia Pictures, Norman Jewison, Ronald L Schwary and Patrick Palmer
results.brief_description: Director Norman Jewison explores themes in “A Soldier’s story” similar to his Academy Award-winning “In the Heat of the Night”. It is World War II and an all black platoon at a Georgia army base spends its time finessing their baseball skills while awaiting the go-ahead to join the war effort. They’re led by the sadistic, incendiary Sergeant Vernon Waters, who rules the platoon with an iron fist and shouts harsh, racist comments even though he himself is an African-American. “A Soldier’s story” begins with the mysterious murder of Waters and then traces the investigation of the crime by black officer, Captain Davenport. Though Davenport suspects two white soldiers of killing Waters, his instincts are proven wrong and the real killer is a dramatic and moving surprise. “A Soldier’s story” is a well-crafted drama that raises the important issue of race relations in America and how racism and discrimination find their way in such official institutions as the military. In fact, the film shows how the military’s power structure supports the abuse of power and iron force rule. Its message overall is bleak: in this microcosmic world of the army, racial discrimination has led to a split in the notion of brotherhood among black men in America with Sergeant Waters internalising and projecting racial conflict on his blood brothers. Cast includes Howard E. Rollins Jr., Adolph Caesar, Art Evans, Denzel Washington and Wings Hauser. Music score by Herbie Hancock.

results.title: A Simple plan
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Company, Paramount Pictures, James Jacks, Adam Schroeder and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: When three men (Bill Paxton, Billy Bob Thornton, Brent Briscoe) find a duffle bag full of money in a plane wreck in the Minnesota woods, they decide to hold onto it. If no-one claims the money they’ll divide it between them and leave town. If it is claimed however, they’ll burn it so that it can’t be traced to them. Even the simplest of plans can start to unravel though when there’s a 4.4 million secret at stake. A taught thriller which shows just what lengths some people will go to to acquire the American dream.

results.title: A Short film about love = Krotki filmo milosci
results.creator_credit: Tor-Film, Polish Corporation for Film Production and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: Tom, a lonely young man who lives in a cramped apartment with his mother, spies on the beautiful Magda - an older woman who lives in a high-rise apartment in the next block. Tom’s fascination with Magda turns into a loving obsession and he is determined to meet and be consumed by the object of his obsession. Based on an episode of his acclaimed television series, “Decalogue”, Kieslowski has crafted a beautifully melancholy movie about the fragility and pathos of love: though of different ages, classes and circumstances, both Tom and Magda share the desire to escape the banality of their lives through the transcendence of human communion.

results.title: A Room with a view
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Based on E M Forster’s classic novel, this film tells the story of a young English couple who encounter passion in Italy and, defying the Victorian conventions of their elders, dare to be true to their emotions and each other. Stars Helena Bonham-Carter, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliot and Julian Sands.

results.title: A room for Romeo Brass
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, BBC Film Unit, George Faber, Charles Pattinson and Shane Meadows
results.brief_description: Shane Meadows writes and directs this drama about two young boys’ friendship and their coming-of-age. Neighbours, the boys share life experiences (and porno magazines) and support each other as one is physically unwell and the other’s parents have separated. The friendship is tested however when a creepy stranger manipulates his way into their lives by trying to date the attractive older sister of Romeo. Tensions arise as the stranger becomes more violent as his affections are rejected. Touching, funny and disturbing, this feature stars Paddy Considine as the stranger, with wonderful performances by the two young leads Andrew Shim and Ben Marshall. Bob Hoskins makes an appearance as a visiting teacher. Soundtrack features music by Beck, Beth Orton and Billy Bragg.

results.title: A River runs through it
results.creator_credit: Allied Filmmakers, Robert Redford and Patrick Markey
results.brief_description: Norman Maclean’s novel has been brought to life under the skillful direction of Robert Redford and fine performances by Tom Skerrit, Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer. Set in the mountain wilderness of Montana between 1910-1935, the story focuses on the relationship between two brothers. Their upbringing at the hands of their strict missionary father influences the boys to chose different paths. One brother goes down the road to success while the other’s path is filled with trouble and heartbreak. The two brothers share little in common except their passion for fly fishing which unites them.
